Key Match Events: The match ended 1-1 after 90 minutes, and Congo DR won 8-7 on penalties
Pre-Game Insights: Egypt, the seven-time champions, have only lost one of their five Africa Cup of Nations encounters against Congo DR
Egypt have displayed a mixed bag of performances in the group stages, including a resilient showing against Ghana and surrendering the lead on two occasions against Cape Verde
Congo DR's passage to the last 16 was very similar to Egypt's, drawing each of their three round-robin fixtures
Post-Match Reflections: The Egyptians will be hoping for a more straightforward result, but history suggests that may not be the case, with four out of their last seven AFCON knockout ties having gone to a penalty shootout
Congo DR have failed to win any of their last six matches in all competitions and have only managed one victory in their last 10
Miscellaneous Highlights: Egypt will remain without their talisman Mohamed Salah, who sustained an injury against Ghana
Congo DR's Yoane Wissa scored the Leopards' opening goal in this competition and will spearhead the attack once again
Egypt's Mostafa Mohamed will lead the attack, having scored in each of the three group-stage matches
